page.title: 03PENZANCE SHOPS AND TRAFFIC
page.content: We surveyed Market Jew Street, Chapel Street,Causewayhead and Alverton Street.{Market Jew Street}is the main road through the middle of the town,becoming Averton Street at the top,and Chapel Street and Cause- wayhead meet it at the Market House. Lots of cars go through Penzance,so Market Jew Street has the most shops. Jams sometimes occur at the top where the roads meet,because of a zebra crossing.However,shoppers have mixed feelings about the new planned distributor road that will{by-pass Penzance. It will help development, but will destroy existing houses and gardens. Alverton Street has the least shops, because it has many services. Chapel Street is only a one-way street. Causewayhead is a new shopping area, rivalling Market Jew Street. Hea.
